passage_text: Salary results for Managing Director. Here you can see the average salary for the job you entered, based on our most recent job adverts. Our salary calculator also lets you view the highest and lowest salaries recently offered for that job, and how your current salary compares. Clicking on 'Top salaries' will provide you with a breakdown of salaries based on industry and location.

For example the median expected annual pay for a typical Data Management Director in the United States is $137,017, so 50% of the people who perform the job of Data Management Director in the United States are expected to make less than $137,017. Source: HR Reported data as of October 2015. 1  Salary. 2  Salary + Bonus. Our team of Certified Compensation Professionals has analyzed survey data collected from thousands of HR departments at companies of all sizes and industries to present this range of annual salaries for people with the job title Data Management Director in the United States.

Managing Director Salary Comparison. The average salary in 2009 was £74,500, based on 317 respondents (a difference of -13% from the 2008 figure. The average salary in 2010 was £87,372, based on 355 respondents (a difference of 17% from the 2009 figure. The average salary in 2012 was £78,050, based on 175 respondents (a difference of 3% from the 2011 figure. The median salary for a Managing Director based on all salary survey responses is: £71,000.
